text: a day of Israeli diplomacy
problem-solving American students and
record iditarod times it may be April
Fool's Day but this is all real today on
the New York Times minute Secretary of
State John Kerry's on the move again
jetting back and forth to Israel as he
tries to extend the April 29th deadline
for an israeli-palestinian peace treaty
into 2015 a separate deal that would
among other things release American
Jonathan Pollard who is serving a life
sentence for spying for Israel may be
near and could buy him some time you've
read the stories about low performing
American students well a new education
survey to reflect on American 15 year
olds performed above average on an exam
measuring problem-solving skills one
question challenged them to figure out
why an electronic device might not be
working the results indicate a knack for
handling real-life situations and
records fell drastically for bicyclists
at this year's Iditarod Trail
invitational instead of pushing through
many feet of snow and abnormally warm
alaskan winter led to smooth cycling
over the thousand mile course many
speculate climate change to be the
culprit but a direct link can't be made
just yet
